death.attack.securitycraft.fakeWater.pla: %1$s在與%2$s戰鬥時掉入有毒的水中...？
help.securitycraft:laserBlock.info: The laser block is used by putting two of them within five blocks of each other. When the blocks are placed correctly, a laser should form between them. Whenever a player walks through the laser, both the laser blocks will emit a 15-block redstone signal.
help.securitycraft:keypad.info: The keypad is used by placing the keypad, rightclicking it, and setting a numerical passcode. Once the keycode is set, rightclicking the keypad will allow you to enter the code. If it's correct, the keypad will emit redstone power for three seconds.
help.securitycraft:mine.info: The mine explodes when stepped on by any entity other than creepers, cats, and ocelots. Rightclicking the mine while holding wire cutters will defuse the mine and allow you to break it. Rightclicking with flint and steel equipped will re-enable it.
help.securitycraft:dirtMine.info: Block mines are standard mines. Walking into it or mining it will cause it to explode. Replace the Dirt in this recipe with Cobblestone, Diamond Ore, Furnace, Gravel, Sand, or Stone for those variations.
help.securitycraft:furnaceMine.info: Furnace mines are just like the standard mines, except it only explodes when you rightclick it.
help.securitycraft:retinalScanner.info: The retinal scanner emits a 15-block redstone signal when its owner hovers the cursor over it from any visible angle within breaking distance.
help.securitycraft:keycardReader.info: The keycard reader emits a 15-block redstone signal if you insert a keycard that matches with the reader's settings. You can configure the Keycard Reader by rightclicking it with anything other than a linked keycard. The signature is a number that links the reader and keycards together. Only keycards that have the same signature as the reader they were linked to will open said reader. Keycards linked to readers of other players will not work for your Keycard Readers. You can have multiple Keycard Readers with the same signature, and all your keycards with that signature will work on them as well. The keycard level buttons on the right side of the GUI are individual to each Keycard Reader and define which keycard levels can be used to activate this Keycard Reader.
help.securitycraft:reinforcedIronTrapdoo: The reinforced iron trapdoor is the same as a vanilla trapdoor, except it can only be opened by Keypads, Inventory Scanners, etc., and only be broken by the person who placed it down.
help.securitycraft:bouncingBetty.info: The bouncing betty will launch up into the air and explode when touched.
help.securitycraft:inventoryScanner.info: The inventory scanner is used by placing two scanners a block apart, facing each other. When placed correctly, a laser field should spawn between them. When a player walks through this field, any blocks or items present in the scanner's GUI that are also present in the player's inventory will either be deleted or a redstone signal will be emitted, depending on the scanner's setting.
help.securitycraft:trackMine.info: The track mine explodes when a minecart passes on top of it.
help.securitycraft:cageTrap.info: The cage trap will spawn a 'cage' around any player who touches it, except for the owner.
help.securitycraft:portableRadar.info: The portable radar will send the owner a chat message whenever a player is inside of the radar's detection radius (modifiable in the config file). You can name the portable radar by rightclicking on it with a named name-tag.
help.securitycraft:keypadChest.info: The password-protected chest is equipped with a password locking system. Whenever the password is entered correctly, the chest's inventory will open.
help.securitycraft:usernameLogger.info: The username logger will log any player's name within 3 blocks when it is powered by redstone.
help.securitycraft:reinforced.info: 強化方塊與原版方塊相比擁有不可破壞的屬性。只有放置它的玩家，使用通用方塊移除器才能夠破壞。
help.securitycraft:alarm.info: The alarm will emit a siren sound effect and flash red whenever it is powered by redstone, and in 2-second intervals after that (modifiable in the config file).
help.securitycraft:reinforcedFenceGate.i: The electrified iron fence gate acts the same as a vanilla fence gate, except it is unbreakable, and can only be opened by Keypads, Inventory Scanners, etc. It will also hurt anyone but the owner when they get in contact with it.
help.securitycraft:panicButton.info: The panic button looks like a button, but works the same way as a lever.
help.securitycraft:keypadFrame.info: The frame is used to craft keypads and to display camera views. Rightclick it with a key panel to craft a keypad.
help.securitycraft:claymore.info: Claymores explode one second after a mob or player walks within 5 blocks in front of the mine. Rightclicking the claymore while holding wire cutters will defuse the mine and allow you to break it. Rightclicking with flint and steel equipped will re-enable it.
help.securitycraft:keypadFurnace.info: The password-protected furnace will require you to enter a passcode when you first place it down. After that, entering the correct code into the GUI will allow you to access the furnace's inventory.
help.securitycraft:securityCamera.info: The security camera allows you to view the nearby area from its position. Simply place down a camera, then rightclick it with a camera monitor to bind it for use.
help.securitycraft:reinforcedStairsStone: Reinforced stone stairs is the same as vanilla stairs, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
help.securitycraft:reinforcedStainedGlas: Reinforced stained glass is the same as vanilla glass, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
Reinforced stained glass panes are the same as vanilla glass panes, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
The electrified iron fence acts the same as a vanilla fence, except it is unbreakable, and will hurt anyone but the owner when they get in contact with it.
help.securitycraft:ims.info: The I.M.S., or Intelligent Munitions System, is a refillable mine holding up to 4 Bouncing Betties that will target players and/or hostile mobs which enter its firing radius. Once a mine is launched, it will track down the entity and explode. If mines are missing from the I.M.S., rightclick it with more Bouncing Betties to refill.
help.securitycraft:reinforcedStairsCobbl: Reinforced Cobblestone Stairs are the same as vanilla stairs, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
help.securitycraft:reinforcedStairsSands: Reinforced Sandstone Stairs are the same as vanilla stairs, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
help.securitycraft:reinforcedWoodSlabs.i: Reinforced wood slabs are the same as vanilla wood slabs, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
Reinforced stone slabs are the same as vanilla stone slabs, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
help.securitycraft:protecto.info: The protecto, inspired by the enemy from the game "Megaman: Battle Network 2" made by Capcom, will attack any mob in a 10-block radius with lightning bolts every 10 seconds while it's raining or snowing with a clear view of the sky.
help.securitycraft:reinforcedStairsStone: Reinforced stone brick stairs are the same as vanilla stairs, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
help.securitycraft:reinforcedStairsBrick: Reinforced brick stairs are the same as vanilla stairs, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
help.securitycraft:reinforcedStairsNethe: Reinforced nether brick stairs are the same as vanilla stairs, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
help.securitycraft:reinforcedStairsQuart: Reinforced quartz stairs are the same as vanilla stairs, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
help.securitycraft:reinforcedStairsRedSa: Reinforced red sandstone stairs are the same as vanilla stairs, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
help.securitycraft:reinforcedStairsPurpu: Reinforced purpur stairs are the same as vanilla stairs, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
The motion-activated light will emit a light, similar to a redstone lamp, when a player is within a certain range of the block (configurable).
help.securitycraft:reinforcedStainedHard: Reinforced stained terracotta is the same as vanilla stained terracotta, except only the person who placed it down can destroy it using the universal block remover.
help.securitycraft:trophy_system.info: The trophy system, inspired by the gadget first seen in "Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3" published by Activision, targets enemy arrows and fireballs and will destroy them from range after a half-second charge time.
help.securitycraft:crystalQuartz.info: Crystal Quartz blocks are building blocks that can be reinforced in the usual way and are crafted analogously to vanilla quartz blocks.
help.securitycraft:reinforcedCrystalQuar: Reinforced Crystal Quartz Blocks are used to build the Block Pocket. More info on the Block Pocket Manager's page.
help.securitycraft:blockPocketWall.info: Block Pocket Walls are used to build the Block Pocket. More info on the Block Pocket Manager's page.
help.securitycraft:blockPocketManager.in: The Block Pocket Manager is used to manage the Block Pocket, which is a room that only its owner and players on the allowlist can enter. When opening its GUI, you see a selection of sizes. Choose one, then build the Block Pocket around the manager. Make sure that the manager is placed on the outside of the bottom layer. The Block Pocket is a cube of the size you chose. The corners are built with Reinforced Chiseled Crystal Quartz, the blocks between the corners are built with correctly oriented Reinforced Crystal Quartz Pillars, and the floor/wall/ceiling is built with Block Pocket Walls. See this image for an example of how it looks (the Block Pocket Manager is marked with a red arrow) https://i.imgur.com/KLQzMeY.png - Clicking "Activate" after the structure is built will activate any added modules. See the customization GUI for more information (rightclick with Universal Block Modifier).
help.securitycraft:reinforced_stone_pres: The Reinforced Pressure Plates can only be activated by their owner or players on the allowlist.
help.securitycraft:reinforced_stone_butt: The Reinforced Buttons can only be activated by their owner or players on the allowlist.
help.securitycraft:reinforced_lever.info: The Reinforced Lever can only be activated by its owner or players on the allowlist.
help.securitycraft:reinforced_hopper.inf: The Reinforced Hopper is the only block that can be used to extract items out of a password protected chest/furnace if both are owned by the same player. It will otherwise act like a vanilla hopper.
help.securitycraft:projector.info: The Projector projects holographic versions of a block of your choice into the world, which can be used to hide buildings and other areas of interest from other players. The range and width of the projection can be changed within the Projector's GUI.
help.securitycraft:codebreaker.info: The codebreaker can crack any keypad, password-protected chest, or password-protected furnace's code by rightclicking on it. (5 uses with a 2/3 chance of it working)
help.securitycraft:doorIndestructibleIro: The reinforced iron door is the same as the vanilla iron door, except it is unbreakable. It can only be opened by Keypads, Inventory Scanners, etc. The owner of the door can use the universal block remover to break it down.
help.securitycraft:scannerDoorItem.info: The Scanner Door acts like a Retinal Scanner combined with a Reinforced Iron Door, where the owner looks at the top to open it.
help.securitycraft:universalBlockRemover: The universal block remover is used to destroy "reinforced" blocks by rightclicking it. Only the person who placed the block down can destroy it.
help.securitycraft:keycardLV1.info: Keycards can be linked to Keycard Readers in order to open them. To reset the settings on keycard, put it into a crafting table. See the Keycard Reader's manual page for more information.
help.securitycraft:keycardLV2.info: Keycards can be linked to Keycard Readers in order to open them. To reset the settings on keycard, put it into a crafting table. See the Keycard Reader's manual page for more information.
help.securitycraft:keycardLV3.info: Keycards can be linked to Keycard Readers in order to open them. To reset the settings on keycard, put it into a crafting table. See the Keycard Reader's manual page for more information.
help.securitycraft:keycardLV4.info: Keycards can be linked to Keycard Readers in order to open them. To reset the settings on keycard, put it into a crafting table. See the Keycard Reader's manual page for more information.
help.securitycraft:keycardLV5.info: Keycards can be linked to Keycard Readers in order to open them. To reset the settings on keycard, put it into a crafting table. See the Keycard Reader's manual page for more information.
help.securitycraft:limitedUseKeycard.inf: This keycard is a crafting component used to add limited usability to the level 1-5 keycards.
help.securitycraft:remoteAccessMine.info: The mine remote access tool will allow you to access mines remotely. Rightclick on a mine to 'bind' it to the tool. Rightclick in the air (with the tool equipped) to open the tool's GUI, which will allow you to activate, deactivate, detonate, or unbind any bound mines.
help.securitycraft:remoteAccessSentry.in: The sentry remote access tool will allow you to access sentries remotely. Rightclick on a sentry to 'bind' it to the tool. Rightclick in the air (with the tool equipped) to open the tool's GUI, which will allow you to change the mode of each bound sentry, or of all bound sentries at the same time.
help.securitycraft:bucketFWater.info: The fake water acts the same as water, except it hurts you, more so than lava, when touched.
help.securitycraft:bucketFLava.info: The fake lava acts the same as lava, except it instantly heals you instead of hurting you.
help.securitycraft:universalBlockModifie: The universal block modifier is used to customize various blocks added by SecurityCraft. Rightclick a block to open the customization GUI. You can then insert "modules" to customize how that block functions.
help.securitycraft:redstoneModule.info: The redstone module adds power properties to a block.
help.securitycraft:whitelistModule.info: The allowlist module usually removes player(s) from a block's effect or password-checking.
help.securitycraft:blacklistModule.info: The denylist module usually adds player(s) to a block's effect or blocks them from using a certain function of the block.
help.securitycraft:harmingModule.info: The harming module adds damage properties to a block.
help.securitycraft:smartModule.info: The smart module upgrades the range or functions of a block.
help.securitycraft:storageModule.info: The storage module adds or upgrades the size of a block's inventory.
help.securitycraft:disguiseModule.info: The disguise module disguises certain blocks when added to them.
help.securitycraft:wireCutters.info: Rightclicking a mine with the wire cutters will defuse it.
help.securitycraft:keypadItem.info: The key panel is used in the crafting recipes of keypads, password-protected chests, and password-protected furnaces.
help.securitycraft:adminTool.info: The admin tool's main purpose is to display information about a SecurityCraft block. It will show the owner's UUID and name, and other information, like passcodes and any inserted modules.
help.securitycraft:taser.info: The taser is a self-recharging stun gun. Rightclick to fire it. Entities hit with the taser will get Nausea II, Slowness II, and Weakness II for 10 seconds. If the Taser is sneak-rightclicked (provided some redstone in the inventory), it will double its strength for the next shot.
help.securitycraft:cameraMonitor.info: The camera monitor is a portable item used to view live feeds of up to 30 bound security cameras. Right-click a security camera with the camera monitor to bind it, then right-click air and select the camera in the GUI while the camera’s chunk is loaded to see its feed. Unbind a security camera by right-clicking it again with the camera monitor or by opening the camera monitor's GUI and clicking the corresponding "X" button.
help.securitycraft:scManual.info: The SecurityCraft Manual shows basic information regarding all the blocks and items SecurityCraft adds. For more in-depth descriptions, check out the FTB wiki at https://ftb.gamepedia.com/SecurityCraft.
help.securitycraft:universalOwnerChanger: The Universal Owner Changer can change a block's owner. To do this, rename the item in an anvil to the name of the new owner of the block. Then just rightclick one of your blocks with an owner and it will change. If enabled, blocks without an owner can be claimed by rightclicking with an unnamed Changer.
help.securitycraft:universalBlockReinfor: The Universal Block Reinforcer reinforces numerous vanilla blocks, and turns them into the SecurityCraft variants. To do this, right-click the Universal Block Reinforcer and put the vanilla block into the top slot, then close the GUI. To convert a reinforced block back to its vanilla variant, use the bottom slot. LvL1 has 300 uses. Break any block outside of Creative mode to reinforce it.

The Universal Block Reinforcer reinforces numerous vanilla blocks, and turns them into the SecurityCraft variants. To do this, right-click the Universal Block Reinforcer and put the vanilla block into the top slot, then close the GUI. To convert a reinforced block back to its vanilla variant, use the bottom slot. LvL2 has 2700 uses. Break any block outside of Creative mode to reinforce it.

The Universal Block Reinforcer reinforces numerous vanilla blocks, and turns them into the SecurityCraft variants. To do this, right-click the Universal Block Reinforcer and put the vanilla block into the top slot, then close the GUI. To convert a reinforced block back to its vanilla variant, use the bottom slot. LvL3 has unlimited uses. Break any block outside of Creative mode to reinforce it.
help.securitycraft:briefcase.info: The briefcase is a keypad-locked portable storage unit containing 12 slots. After crafting it, rightclick it to setup the 4-digit passcode to use from then on. Rightclick it again and insert the code to interact with the items. To remove a Briefcase's code or change its owner, put it into your offhand and rightclick while holding a Universal Key Changer/Universal Owner Changer in your mainhand.
help.securitycraft:universalKeyChanger.i: The universal key changer allows you to change the passcode of passcode-protected blocks you own. Rightclick a passcode-protected block to open a GUI, then type in the new passcode you want.
help.securitycraft:secretSignItem.info: The Secret Sign works like a vanilla sign, with the slight difference that only the owner of the sign and players on the allowlist can interact with, and view the text on it. Make sure noone can break the block it's placed on!
help.securitycraft:sentry.info: The Sentry has three modes that can be switched by rightclicking it. Idle (it will never attack), Camouflage (it will only attack enemy players in its range) and Aggressive (it will attack hostile mobs and enemy players). Rightclicking it with a Disguise Module containing a full and opaque block (e.g. stone, but not glass or stairs) will make the Sentry disguise itself. The module can be switched directly, or extracted by rightclicking with a Universal Block Modifier. To remove the sentry, sneak-rightclick it.
help.securitycraft:crystalQuartzItem.inf: Crystal Quartz is used to craft Crystal Quartz blocks.
help.securitycraft:keypad_door_item.info: The Keypad Door acts like a Keypad combined with a Reinforced Iron Door, where a code has to be inserted in order to open the door.
help.securitycraft:speed_module.info: The speed module allows some of SecurityCraft's blocks to operate faster than usual.
gui.securitycraft:scManual.intro.2: 由 Geforce 和 bl4ckscor3 所著
gui.securitycraft:scManual.ownableBlock: 擁有者保護：這個方塊能夠抵禦爆炸，只能夠被放置它的玩家使用通用方塊移除器所破壞。
gui.securitycraft:scManual.passwordProte: 密碼保護：這個方塊只有在密碼輸入正確時才能夠使用。
gui.securitycraft:scManual.viewActivated: 查看啟用：這個方塊在玩家可破壞範圍內，同時滑鼠指針指向時能夠啟用。
gui.securitycraft:scManual.explosiveBloc: 爆炸：這個方塊能夠被遠程引爆，也可以被啟用/取消啟用，使用遠程地雷訪問工具能夠進行訪問。
gui.securitycraft:scManual.customizableB: 可自訂：你可以使用通用方塊修改器或者其他 SecurityCraft 加入的模組來對方塊功能進行自訂。
gui.securitycraft:scManual.recipe.reinfo: 由通用方塊強化器中的一般水晶石英塊製成。
gui.securitycraft:scManual.recipe.keypad: 放置一個框架，並用鍵盤右擊它。
放置一個儲物箱，然後使用鍵盤（物品）右擊它。
放置一個熔爐，然後使用鍵盤（物品）右擊它。
gui.securitycraft:scManual.recipe.reinfo: 任意強化方塊均可透過如下方式合成：放置一個對應的普通的原版方塊（比如強化石頭->石頭），然後使用通用方塊強化器左擊它，亦或是在使用通用方塊破壞器右擊時，在GUI格子中放置對應方塊即可。
任意強化方塊均可透過如下方式合成：放置一個對應的普通的原版方塊（比如強化石頭->石頭），然後使用通用方塊強化器左擊它，亦或是在使用通用方塊破壞器右擊時，在GUI格子中放置對應方塊即可。
gui.securitycraft:scManual.recipe.admin_: 管理員工具在修改配置檔案後，才可在創造模式物品欄中獲得。
gui.securitycraft:scManual.recipe.sc_man: SecurityCraft指南僅在創造模式物品欄可獲得，或者輸入 /sc help 指令。
gui.securitycraft:scManual.patreon.title: Our Patrons:
gui.securitycraft:invScan.emit_redstone: 在找到以上物品時發射紅石訊號：%s
gui.securitycraft:protectedFurnace.name: 密碼爐
gui.securitycraft:mrat.name: Remote access tool for mines
gui.securitycraft:srat.name: 哨兵遠端訪問工具
gui.securitycraft:monitor.selectCameras: 選擇需要查看的攝影機：
gui.securitycraft:monitor.cameraInDiffer: You may not view this camera now, as this camera is in another dimension with the ID #.
gui.securitycraft:blockReinforcer.title: 通用方塊強化器
gui.securitycraft:blockPocketManager.nee: 需要一個儲存模組來實現防禦空間的自動組裝。
gui.securitycraft:trophy_system.moduleRe: You need to install a Smart Module to toggle which projectile types can be targeted by this Trophy System.
gui.securitycraft:trophy_system.toggle: Click the entries in the list below to toggle the targeting of that specific projectile type.
gui.securitycraft:keycard_reader.noSmart: You need a Smart Module to control the keycard levels individually.
gui.securitycraft:keycard_reader.level_m: The level of this keycard is not enabled in this keycard reader!
messages.securitycraft:bugReport: 你可以使用 GoogleDocs 表格進行崩潰或者 bug 回饋。
messages.securitycraft:retinalScanner.no: 抱歉你無法使用這個掃描器，它的所有者是 #。
messages.securitycraft:portableRadar.wit: #p 在你的雷達附近，坐標為 #l。
messages.securitycraft:codebreakerDisabl: 編碼破壞器已經被配置檔案所停用。
messages.securitycraft:codebreaker.faile: Code breaking attempt failed, please try again.
messages.securitycraft:keycardReader.dif: The Keycard Reader that this card was linked to belongs to a different player than the one you are trying to use!
messages.securitycraft:keycardReader.wro: The signature saved on this card does not match the Keycard Reader's signature!
This Keycard Reader does not allow keycards of level %s!
messages.securitycraft:keycardReader.noU: This Keycard does not have any uses left!
messages.securitycraft:invScan.notConnec: 這個方塊對面缺少另一個掃描器！
messages.securitycraft:module.onAllowlis: You are added to the allowlist.
messages.securitycraft:module.onDenylist: You are added to the denylist.
messages.securitycraft:module.notHolding: 你必須手持你想儲存數據的模組。
messages.securitycraft:module.alreadyCon: 你手持的模組已經包含玩家 #。
messages.securitycraft:module.added: 已加入 # 到手持模組。
messages.securitycraft:module.removed: 已移除 # 出手持模組。
messages.securitycraft:module.notHolding: 你必須手持想要修改的模組！
messages.securitycraft:notOwned: 抱歉，你不能這麼做，因為此方塊屬於 #。
messages.securitycraft:adminTool.noInfo: 這個方塊沒有資訊可顯示！
messages.securitycraft:adminTool.needCre: 您需要處於創造模式才能使用管理工具。
messages.securitycraft:adminTool.disable: The Admin Tool has been disabled through the config file.
messages.securitycraft:reinforcedSlab.ca: 你必須是這個方塊的所有者才能夠轉變成雙層台階。
messages.securitycraft:cameraMonitor.can: 你無法查看這個攝影機，因為它不屬於你
messages.securitycraft:cameraMonitor.bou: 將（#）處的攝影機與監視器綁定。
messages.securitycraft:cameraMonitor.unb: 將（#）處的攝影機與監視器解綁。
messages.securitycraft:cameraMonitor.rig: 右擊安防攝影機進行查看。
messages.securitycraft:mrat.noSlots: 沒有多餘格子來綁定這個地雷！
messages.securitycraft:mrat.cantBind: 你無法綁定一個不屬於你的地雷。
messages.securitycraft:mrat.bound: Bound the mine at %s to the remote access tool.
messages.securitycraft:mrat.unbound: 遠端存取工具已經解綁位於 # 地雷。
messages.securitycraft:srat.noSlots: 沒有更多的空插槽綁定這個哨兵！
messages.securitycraft:srat.cantBind: 你不能約束一個不屬於你的哨兵。
messages.securitycraft:srat.bound: 已將%s的哨兵連結到遠端訪問工具。
messages.securitycraft:universalOwnerCha: 你必須要先給予一個新的所有者名稱。使用鐵砧來重名它。
這個方塊無法儲存所有者資訊，你需要找一個合適的SecurityCraft方塊來進行操作。
這個方塊不是你的，你無法改變所有者。
沒有所有者，你無法聲明方塊。
這不是你的公事包，你不能改變它的主人。
messages.securitycraft:irc.connected: IRC 聊天在 v1.8.3 版本 SecurityCraft 後已經不再支持，如果你想要尋求幫助，請到 SecurityCraft 的 Discord #help 頻道尋求幫助。
messages.securitycraft:frame.rightclick: Viewing a camera monitor in a frame is currently not possible because LookingGlass has not been ported to any version newer than 1.7.10. In a future update, this feature might return without depending on any library mod like LookingGlass, however it is unknown when exactly.
messages.securitycraft:command.sc.usage: /sc connect 或者 /sc disconnect 或者 /sc contact 或者 /sc resume
messages.securitycraft:naming.alreadyMat: 這個方塊的名稱已經匹配了 '#n'。
messages.securitycraft:tip.scHelp: 輸入 /sc help 將會給你一本 SecurityCraft 指南，能夠顯示 SecurityCraft 模組的所有物品/方塊資訊。
messages.securitycraft:tip.patreon: 你願意支持 SecurityCraft 麼？
messages.securitycraft:tip.discord: 加入我們的 Discord 進行聊天，或者接受 SecurityCraft 模組重要的更新消息、公告！
messages.securitycraft:tip.outdated: 您的安全世界版本已過時！考慮更新以提供更多的功能和更少的錯誤。
messages.securitycraft:tip.scserver: 官方 SecurityCraft 伺服器已經回歸！，通過 IP: 64.38.249.237 加入我們吧！
messages.securitycraft:universalKeyChang: 使用通用密鎖變換器右擊鍵盤修改密碼。
此公事包的密碼已重置。
這個公事包沒有密碼，不能重置。
這不是你的公事包，你不能改變它的密碼。
messages.securitycraft:passwordProtected: 方塊還沒有設置密碼，你無法進行互動。
messages.securitycraft:sentry.needsBlock: 你必須把哨兵安置在一個方塊的頂上！
Make sure, that your Sentry is surrounded with blocks on all of its four sides!
messages.securitycraft:sentry.descriptio: （始終活躍，攻擊敵對的暴徒和玩家）
（當敵對的暴徒或玩家靠近時啟動，攻擊敵對的暴徒和玩家）
（當敵對暴徒靠近時啟動，攻擊敵對暴徒）
（當玩家靠近時啟動，攻擊玩家）
messages.securitycraft:blockpocket.multi: 結構中有多個防禦空間管理器。
messages.securitycraft:blockpocket.alrea: 防禦空間已經組裝好了！
messages.securitycraft:blockpocket.inval: 支柱%1$s防禦空間管理器旋轉不正確！
無效區塊"%2$s"%1$s防禦空間管理器！（預期:"%3$s"）
messages.securitycraft:blockpocket.block: "%2$s"正在阻止空間%1$s防禦空間管理器！
messages.securitycraft:blockpocket.unown: You do not own the block \"%2$s\" %1$s of the Block Pocket Manager!
messages.securitycraft:blockpocket.notEn: 你沒有足夠的項目來組裝這種大小的防禦空間！
messages.securitycraft:blockpocket.assem: Assembling the Block Pocket has failed %1$s the Block Pocket Manager. (Incorrect Block: %2$s)
你可以加入 # 個方塊。
你可以加入 # 個物品。
You may add %$1s block(s) and %2$s item(s).
tooltip.securitycraft:projector: Projects fake blocks into the world.
tooltip.securitycraft:keycard.reader_own: Works on Keycard Readers owned by: %s
tooltip.securitycraft:keycard.link_info: Put this card into a Keycard Reader to link it.
tooltip.securitycraft:keycard.limited_in: Combine this card with a Limited Use Keycard in a crafting table to control how often it can be used.
module.securitycraft:ims.whitelistModule: Adding an allowlist module to an I.M.S. will allow listed players to walk into the range of the I.M.S. without being targeted.
module.securitycraft:ims.speed_module.de: Adding a speed module to an I.M.S. will make the I.M.S. shoot faster, as well as increase the speed of the shot bombs.
module.securitycraft:inventoryScanner.wh: Adding an allowlist module to an inventory scanner will allow listed players to walk through the scanning field without checking their inventory.
module.securitycraft:inventoryScanner.sm: Adding a smart module to an inventory scanner will make the scanner check for enchantments and other metadata changes when scanning inventories.
module.securitycraft:inventoryScanner.st: Adding a storage module will allow the scanner to store the items it finds while something passes through the field in a built-in inventory.
module.securitycraft:inventoryScanner.di: Adding a disguise module to an inventory scanner will cause the texture & model of it to change to the texture & model of the block that is added to the disguise module.
module.securitycraft:inventoryScanner.re: Adding a redstone module to an inventory scanner will cause it to emit a redstone signal whenever a listed item is found when something passes through its field.
module.securitycraft:keycardReader.white: Adding an allowlist module to a keycard reader will allow listed players to link their own keycards to the reader and view its settings.
module.securitycraft:keycardReader.black: Adding a denylist module to a keycard reader will ban listed players from interacting with the reader.
module.securitycraft:keycardReader.disgu: Adding a disguise module to a keycard reader will cause the texture & model of it to change to the texture & model of the block that is added to the disguise module.
module.securitycraft:keycardReader.smart: Adding a smart module to a keycard reader will allow for unrestricted control of the keycard levels accepted by the keycard reader.
module.securitycraft:keypad.whitelistMod: Adding an allowlist module to a keypad will allow listed players to use the block without knowing the code.
module.securitycraft:keypad.blacklistMod: Adding a denylist module to a keypad will ban listed players from interacting with the block.
module.securitycraft:keypad.disguiseModu: Adding a disguise module to a keypad will cause the texture & model of it to change to the texture & model of the block that is added to the disguise module.
module.securitycraft:laserBlock.harmingM: Adding a harming module to a laser block will cause players to take damage if they step through the lasers.
module.securitycraft:laserBlock.whitelis: Adding an allowlist module to a laser block will allow listed players to walk through the lasers without emitting a redstone signal.
module.securitycraft:laserBlock.disguise: Adding a disguise module to a laser block will cause the texture & model of it to change to the texture & model of the block that is added to the disguise module.
module.securitycraft:portableRadar.redst: Adding a redstone module to a portable radar will cause the radar to emit a redstone signal whenever a player is within range.
module.securitycraft:portableRadar.white: Adding an allowlist module to a portable radar will remove listed players from the radar's search.
module.securitycraft:retinalScanner.whit: Adding an allowlist module to a retinal scanner will allow listed players to use the scanner even if they aren't the player who placed down the block.
module.securitycraft:retinalScanner.disg: Adding a disguise module to a retinal scanner will cause the texture & model of it to change to the texture & model of the block that is added to the disguise module.
module.securitycraft:securityCamera.reds: Adding the redstone module to a camera lets the camera emit a 15-block redstone signal when enabled.
module.securitycraft:securityCamera.smar: Adding the smart module to a camera lets anyone access the camera.
module.securitycraft:protecto.whitelistM: Adding an allowlist module to a protecto will allow listed players to walk into the range of the protecto without being targeted.
module.securitycraft:protecto.speed_modu: Adding a speed module to a protecto will allow it to attack twice as fast.
Adding a disguise module to a Block Pocket Manager will make the Block Pocket's sides opaque.
Adding an allowlist module to a Block Pocket Manager will allow listed players to pass through the Block Pocket's sides.

Adding a storage module to a Block Pocket Manager will add an inventory to it, allowing you to store the blocks you need for building the Block Pocket. This also allows you to auto-assemble the Block Pocket if all necessary building materials are present.
module.securitycraft:reinforced_stone_pr: Adding an allowlist module to a Reinforced Stone Pressure Plate will allow listed players to activate it.
module.securitycraft:usernameLogger.disg: Adding a disguise module to a username logger will cause the texture & model of it to change to the texture & model of the block that is added to the disguise module.
module.securitycraft:cageTrap.disguiseMo: Adding a disguise module to a cage trap will cause the texture & model of it to change to the texture & model of the block that is added to the disguise module.
module.securitycraft:cageTrap.whitelistM: Adding an allowlist module to a Cage Trap will prevent listed players from being trapped.
module.securitycraft:reinforced_wooden_p: Adding an allowlist module to a Reinforced Oak Pressure Plate will allow listed players to activate it.
module.securitycraft:reinforced_stone_bu: Adding an allowlist module to a Reinforced Button will allow listed players to activate it.
module.securitycraft:reinforced_wooden_b: Adding an allowlist module to a Reinforced Button will allow listed players to activate it.
module.securitycraft:reinforced_lever.wh: Adding an allowlist module to a Reinforced Lever will allow listed players to activate it.
module.securitycraft:keypadChest.whiteli: Adding an allowlist module to a Password-protected Chest will allow listed players to open it without knowing the code. Additionally, Reinforced Hoppers owned by listed players can extract items from the chest.
module.securitycraft:keypadChest.blackli: Adding a denylist module to a Password-protected Chest will ban listed players from interacting with the block.
module.securitycraft:keypadChest.redston: Adding a redstone module to a Password-protected Chest will make the chest output a redstone signal while being open, with a strength depending on how many players are simultaneously looking into the chest.
module.securitycraft:keypadFurnace.white: Adding an allowlist module to a Password-protected Furnace will allow listed players to open it without knowing the code. Additionally, Reinforced Hoppers owned by listed players can extract items from the furnace.
module.securitycraft:keypadFurnace.black: Adding a denylist module to a Password-protected Furnace will ban players from interacting with the block.
module.securitycraft:projector.redstoneM: Adding a redstone module to a Projector will allow you to manually toggle the Projector on and off using redstone power.
module.securitycraft:projector.disguiseM: Adding a disguise module to a Projector will cause the texture & model of it to change to the texture & model of the block that is added to the disguise module.
module.securitycraft:secret_sign.whiteli: Adding an allowlist module to a Secret Sign will allow listed players to interact with, and view the text on it.
module.securitycraft:scannerDoor.whiteli: Adding an allowlist module to a scanner door will allow listed players to use the scanner door even if they aren't the player who placed down the block.
module.securitycraft:reinforced_hopper.w: Adding an allowlist module to a reinforced hopper will allow listed players to access the hopper's contents and extract out of their own password-protected chests/furnaces/... using this hopper.
module.securitycraft:keypad_door.whiteli: Adding an allowlist module to a keypad door will allow listed players to use the block without knowing the code.
module.securitycraft:keypad_door.blackli: Adding a denylist module to a keypad door will ban listed players from interacting with the block.
module.securitycraft:usernameLogger.whit: Adding an allowlist module to a Username Logger will prevent listed players from being logged.
module.securitycraft:trophy_system.smart: Adding a smart module to a Trophy System will allow you to configure which projectile types the Trophy System is allowed to target.
module.securitycraft:trophy_system.white: Adding an allowlist module to a Trophy System will make it ignore projectiles thrown by listed playerss, as well as their Sentries' bullets and I.M.S.' bombs.
module.securitycraft:trophy_system.speed: Adding a speed module to a Trophy System allows it to destroy targets twice as fast.
module.securitycraft:reinforced_cauldron: Adding an allowlist module to a Reinforced Cauldron will allow listed playerss to interact with the Reinforced Cauldron.
config.securitycraft:shouldSpawnFire: 地雷起爆時是否產生火？
config.securitycraft:shouldSpawnFire.too: 地雷起爆後是否產生火？
config.securitycraft:ableToBreakMines.to: 玩家能否破壞地雷而不爆炸？
config.securitycraft:ableToCraftLUKeycar: 能否合成有限制次數的安全卡？
能否合成有限制次數的安全卡
config.securitycraft:mineExplodesWhenInC: 創造模式下破壞是否爆炸？
創造模式下破壞是否爆炸？
config.securitycraft:fiveMinAutoShutoff: 監視器五分鐘後自動關閉？
如果安裝了 LookingGlass，是否在五分鐘後自動關閉監視器以節省資源？
config.securitycraft:useLookingGlass: 使用 LookingGlass 來觀看監視器？
config.securitycraft:useLookingGlass.too:
SecurityCraft 是否使用 LookingGlass 來查看攝影機？

當 LookingGlass 沒有安裝，自動設置為“false”。
config.securitycraft:sayThanksMessage.to: 當玩家進入世界的時候向玩家發送小建議資訊？
config.securitycraft:debuggingMode: 是 debug 模式嗎？（不推薦打開）
config.securitycraft:debuggingMode.toolt: 是否開啟 SecurityCraft 的 debug 模式（將會顯示更多的日誌資訊，還有可能開啟充斥著 bug 的未完成的物品/方塊）
config.securitycraft:isIrcBotEnabled: 是否啟用 IRC 機器人？
config.securitycraft:isIrcBotEnabled.too: 是否啟用內建的聊天機器人（使用 "/sc connect" 或者 "/sc contact" 指令）？
config.securitycraft:disconnectOnWorldCl: 當退出時斷開 IRC 聊天機器人？
如果你使用 "/sc connect" 或者 "/sc contact"，是否 IRC 機器人在你離開所處世界時斷線？
config.securitycraft:useOldKeypadRecipe: 啟用舊式鍵盤合成（九個按鈕）？
是否啟用九個按鈕合成的舊式鍵盤合成表？
config.securitycraft:cameraSpeed.tooltip: 當玩家按下 W-A-S-D 鍵時，鏡頭旋轉速度。
config.securitycraft:checkForUpdates: 是否啟用 GitHub 的更新檢測？
config.securitycraft:checkForUpdates.too: 是否啟用與 SecurityCraft GitHub 倉庫的聯網更新檢測？
config.securitycraft:allowBlockClaim: 允許聲稱沒有擁有權的塊？
config.securitycraft:allowBlockClaim.too: Should players be able to claim blocks that have no owner by using the Universal Owner Changer?
config.securitycraft:maxAlarmRange.toolt: 警示範圍選項的最大值是多大值？請注意，這可能受大塊載入距離的限制。更高的值也未必是微調的。
config.securitycraft:respectInvisibility: Should the sentry/inventory scanner/laser block/etc. ignore players and entities that are invisible?
config.securitycraft:reinforcedBlockTint: Should reinforced blocks' textures be slightly darker than their vanilla counterparts?
config.securitycraft:ableToCraftMines.to: 所有的地雷（彈跳貝蒂/闊刀地雷/泥土地雷/石礦/...）都是可製作的嗎？
config.securitycraft:retinalScannerFace: 視網膜掃描器上顯示所有者的臉？
視網膜掃描器是否應該在塊上呈現其擁有者的臉？（如果您對Mojang的身份驗證伺服器有問題，則停用此伺服器）
config.securitycraft:mineExplosionsBreak: Set this to false if you want mines to not break blocks when they explode.
option.securitycraft:portableRadar.searc: The radius the radar searches in.
The rate at which the radar searches at.
option.securitycraft:portableRadar.repea: Should the radar repeat the message as long as someone is in its radius?
option.securitycraft:portableRadar.enabl: Should the Portable Radar search for any players?
option.securitycraft:securityCamera.rota: The speed at which the camera rotates.
option.securitycraft:keypad.isAlwaysActi: Should the keypad remain active and unlocked?
Does this keypad send a message upon activation (when using allowlist/denylist modules)?

Signal length: #

Signal length: #
option.securitycraft:retinalScanner.signalLength.description=How long should the redstone signal upon successful activation be? (In ticks, 20 ticks = 1 second)

Time until closing: #
option.securitycraft:scannerDoor.signalLength.description=How long should the door stay open? (In Ticks, 20 ticks = 1 second. Set to 0 to have the door stay open)

option.securitycraft:alarm.delay.descrip: If an alarm is activated, how many seconds in-between alarm sounds effects?
option.securitycraft:alarmLit.range.desc: How many blocks away can the alarm sound be heard?
option.securitycraft:alarmLit.delay.desc: If an alarm is activated, how many seconds in-between alarm sounds effects?
option.securitycraft:cageTrap.captureMob: Should this cage trap capture hostile mobs and players, or only players?
option.securitycraft:motionActivatedLigh: How far will the light detect an entity?
option.securitycraft:keycardReader.sendM: Does this keycard reader send a message upon activation (when using allowlist/denylist modules)?
option.securitycraft:keycardReader.signa:
Signal length: #
option.securitycraft:keycardReader.signalLength.description=How long should the redstone signal upon successful activation be? (In ticks, 20 ticks = 1 second)
option.securitycraft:keypadChest.sendMes: Does this chest send a message upon activation (when using allowlist/denylist modules)?
option.securitycraft:keypadFurnace.sendM: Does this furnace send a message upon activation (when using allowlist/denylist modules)?
option.securitycraft:inventoryScanner.ho: Should the inventory scanner fields created by this scanner be horizontal?
option.securitycraft:inventoryScanner.so: Should the inventory scanner's fields solidify when a prohibited item is detected?
option.securitycraft:secret_sign.isSecre: Should the text of the secret sign only be visible to the owner and players on the allowlist?

option.securitycraft:ims.range.descripti: How many blocks away can the I.M.S. detect potential targets from?

Signal length: #

option.securitycraft:reinforced_cauldron: Should every player be able to interact with this block?
